Compare.graph_title: Trends in Disinfection By-Product in New York City Drinking Water (TTHM)

info.info_how_calculated: Samples are collected from the drinking water distribution system, and concentrations of chloroform, bromodichloromethane, dibromochloromethane, and bromoform are summed within samples to derive a measure of total trihalomethane (TTHM).  If a concentration is below the limit of detection (LOD), a value equal to one half the LOD is assigned. The maximum total concentration is identified for each year and compared to the Maximum Contaminant Level (MCL), which is the highest level of a contaminant that is allowed in drinking water, according to regulatory standards.
info.info_source: New York State Safe Drinking Water Information System

info.info_how_calculated: The highest level of TTHM that is allowed in drinking water, according to regulatory standards.

Samples are collected from the drinking water distribution system, and concentrations of chloroform, bromodichloromethane, dibromochloromethane, and bromoform are summed within samples to derive a measure of total trihalomethane (TTHM).  If a concentration is below the limit of detection (LOD), a value equal to one half the LOD is assigned. Total concentrations are averaged over the year and compared to the Maximum Contaminant Level (MCL), which is the highest level of a contaminant that is allowed in drinking water, according to regulatory standards.
info.info_source: New York State Safe Drinking Water Information System

Samples are collected from the drinking water distribution system, and concentrations of chloroform, bromodichloromethane, dibromochloromethane, and bromoform are summed within samples to derive a measure of total trihalomethane (TTHM).  If a concentration is below the limit of detection (LOD), a value equal to one half the LOD is assigned. The maximum total concentration is identified for each quarter and compared to the Maximum Contaminant Level (MCL), which is the highest level of a contaminant that is allowed in drinking water, according to regulatory standards.
